Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
Internship and Career Open Houses at BYU-Idaho are scheduled three times per year to give students the opportunity to meet face-to-face with Hub Service Missionaries from thirteen cities across the United States.

The Hub Service Missionaries come to campus to conduct information sessions and one-on-one interviews with students interested in internships and jobs in their city.

In March the Hub Service Missionaries from Minneapolis, Denver, Salt Lake City, New York City, Chicago, Washington DC, and Idaho Falls are scheduled for an Open House.

In September Hub Service Missionaries from Phoenix, San Jose, Boise, Dallas, Seattle, Los Angeles, and Idaho Falls come to campus for an Open House.

In June all of the missionaries come to BYU-Idaho to conduct a thirteen city Open House. Hub Service Missionaries serve one to two years in their home cities.

Their calling is to open doors of opportunity for BYU-Idaho students as they seek internships and careers. Hub Service Missionaries are an excellent resource because of their connections and experience with local business and industry leaders.
